com.iha.emulator.utilities.watchers

Class QueueWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iha.emulator.utilities.watchers.QueueWatcher

  • public class QueueWatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for automatic processing of SimulationTasks. Enables to start processing at predefined time.
    Author:
    Filip Sutovsky

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueueWatcher

        public QueueWatcher(PerformanceSimulationPresenter simulation,
                    javafx.collections.ObservableList<SimulationTask> tasks)
        Creates instance of QueueWatcher, that is responsible for automatic processing of given tasks. Initiates, but not starts, queue watcher timer.
        Parameters:
        simulation - "Performance simulation" class
        tasks - list of tasks

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Switches current simulation task to null, so no task is running. Start timer immediately or in set time according to previous configuration.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Nor delayed start time, neither immediate start is set

      • next

        public void next()
        If queue watcher is enabled, picks and starts next simulation task

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Disables queue watcher and stops timer if it is running

      • processQueue

        public void processQueue()
        Picks next simulation task with READY SimulationTask.State and starts it.

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer()
        Starts time, that every 2 seconds looks if next task should be started

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        Stops queue watcher timer

      • getEnabled

        public boolean getEnabled()
        Gets flag, if queue watcher is enabled
        Returns:
        true if it is enabled, false otherwise

        enabled - true if queue watcher is enabled, false otherwise

      • getImmediateStart

        public boolean getImmediateStart()
        Gets flag, if automatic processing should start immediately
        Returns:
        true if automatic processing should start immediately, false otherwise

        Parameters:

      • initDateTimePicker

        public void initDateTimePicker(jfxtras.scene.control.LocalDateTimeTextField localDateTimeTextField)
        Initiates date-time picker. Adds text field change listener, so user couldn't choose start time before now
        Parameters:
        localDateTimeTextField - text field with start date-time
